AVSEC ORDER  09 / 2001 
 
 
SUB :IN ORDER TO PROVIDE SECURITY COVERAGE TO THE 
PASSENGERS ON BOARD ALL AIR-CARRIES 
REGISTERED IN INDIA SHALL CARRY SKY MARSHAL 
FREE OF CHARGE 
 
 
In exercise of the powers, conferred by Section 5A of the Aircraft Act, 
1934 (XXII of 1934), delegated to him by the Central Government vide the 
Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation notification number S.O. 1797, 
dated the 3rd July, 1997, the Commissioner of the Security, Civil Aviation, Bureau 
of Civil Security, for the purpose of security of the aircraft operations, directs that: 
- 
 
If an aircraft registered in India, is hijacked and lands at any airport in India, it 
shall not be allowed to take off.  The aircraft shall be immobilized by any of the 
under mentioned procedure found suitable at that time; 
 
Positioning vehicles / fire tenders on the runway.  Deflating of tyres by personnel 
coming from the rear end. Putting off the lights of the runway / taxi track (at 
night).  Any other means, without endangering the safety of the aircraft and the 
security of passengers. 
 
 (VEERANNA AIVALLI) 
COMMISSIONER OF SECURITY (CIVIL AVIATION) 
 
 
( REF :NO.CAS-5 (1)2001/Div-I 
Dated 16.11.2001)
